intro: Rhinanthus tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leaved common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it has a flowering stem that is often branched.
